alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Monroe and Wilcox. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 741 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms producing very heavy rain over the advisory area. 1.5 to 2.5 inches of rain have likely fallen over some locations during the past hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Peterman, Beatrice, Pine Apple, Pineville, Riley, Turnbull, Nadawah, Chestnut, Pine Orchard, McWilliams, Natchez, Buena Vista, Skinnerton, Tunnel Springs, Scotland, Old Texas and River Ridge.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
